Comments: Blastochloris viridis ATCC19567 whole genome sequencing

Blastochloris viridis is a unique anaerobic, phototrophic purple bacterium that produces bacteriochlorophyll b. This study provides a complete genome sequence of Blastochloris viridis DSM133, which is instrumental to the studies of photosynthesis, metabolic versatility and genetic engineering of this microorganism.;Purple Photosynthetic Bacterium
We determined complete genome sequence of Blastochloris viridis, which will facilitate the research of chlorophyll synthetic pathway of this photosynthetic bacterium.

Isolation Source: hospital NICU surfaces and sink samples
Geographic Location: USA: Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania Magee Womens Hospital
Comments: This data was generated to recover genomes from hospital (NICU) surfaces and sinks.

Comments: A complete genome sequence of Blastochloris tepida was obtained using the PacBio sequencer. This study describes Blastochloris tepida as a new species of the Blastochloris genus.

Isolation Comments: isolated as Rhodopseudomonas sulfoviridis from a sulfur spring in the former Soviet Union
Comments: Blastochloris sulfoviridis is a bacterium from the genus of Blastochloris which uses sulfur compounds as energy sources. Blastochloris sulfoviridis was originally isolated as Rhodopseudomonas sulfoviridis from a sulfur spring in the former Soviet Union.
